Articles.Content:
A small MM config to reduce the prices to 10% of their original mod value. 21000 for a single cargo piece was hurting my career mode wallet a bit to much . 2100 is still way higher than most structural pieces that I have, but it is obviously made from the highest quality material.


@PART[TALLargeCargoASeparator]
{
	cost = 2100
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoASeparatorHollow]
{
	cost = 2100
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoAdapter]
{
	cost = 2100

Seems to be working fine in 64 bit .24 as well

Where can I find the most resent download link please and thank you.

Where can I find the most resent download link please and thank you.

The download link is in the original post.

The non-animated parts will work with any version of KSP as they do nothing (just structural).

The animated parts require firespitter (see note at bottom of OP), so you will need a firespitter DLL that works with the current version of KSP, which you should place in the root of your GameData folder.
Seems to me the DL link is broken
The downlink link is working fine : http://www./download/axvvdet7aa0acf1/TalCargoSolutionsV0.3.4.zip
Is there an ETA for an updated version for .24.x?
How does this play with RSS and realism overhaul?

I can't get hangar doors to close

I'm playing v.24.0 for few mods compatibility, CTS is working, I did copy the Firespitter.dll into Plugins, GameData and CTS folders and still no effect. Tried both the raw Firespitter.dll from github page and one I extracted from whole Firespitter zip for .24 version. I think animation is not missing because when I add hangar bay its doors briefly slide open but then I can't do anything with it. Action groups (vanilla and AGX) show there is no action for hangar door.

This is a great mod, simple and universal but it's weird to not be able to close hangars

Anything I might be doing wrong?

I can't get hangar doors to close

...

This is a great mod, simple and universal but it's weird to not be able to close hangars

Anything I might be doing wrong?

I'm not having a problem with .24. Are you on 64-bit?
not to seem like a turdburglar but what kind of time frame are we looking at for the tech integration? I only ask because im really eager to try the mod. thank you for your hard work!

I'm not having a problem with .24. Are you on 64-bit?

I'm on 32-bit and actually I got this to work but now I get crashes or freezes in vab or when I click launch. That's probably some other mod conflicting (I've got like 15) so maybe also that was causing plugin problems. Will try to find cause, thanks for the help anyway
Does this have a support of Deadly Reentry? Like, does it shield stuff inside of cargobay?

I'm on 32-bit and actually I got this to work but now I get crashes or freezes in vab or when I click launch. That's probably some other mod conflicting (I've got like 15) so maybe also that was causing plugin problems. Will try to find cause, thanks for the help anyway

I had both of these issues in the past. What it ended up being was a duplicate firespitter.dll somewhere.

Go out to https://github.com/snjo/Firespitter/blob/master/For%20release/Firespitter/Plugins/Firespitter.dll?raw=true to download the latest Firespitter.dll, put that someplace sane.

Do a find files & folders on your GameData directory (or dir firespitter.dll /b/s from the command line or find . -name firespitter.dll -print if unix or mac) to find any possible duplicate firespitter.dll files.

That might just solve your issue, when I did this I found two random firespitter.dlls that had been installed at some point with some mod.

not to seem like a turdburglar but what kind of time frame are we looking at for the tech integration? I only ask because im really eager to try the mod. thank you for your hard work!

It's in the tech tree now. It's not unlocked until later though. I think smaller pieces should be unlocked earlier though. Just make sure you use the price fix a page or 2 back. I found that out after burning through 2 million funds!
Thanks for a super cool mod!
Is docking ring only way to break the truss to get things inside out?
The mod still working on ksp 24.2? and x64 of course =P

Is docking ring only way to break the truss to get things inside out?

You can use decouplers/seperators if you want to. It's a lot easier just using the docking rings though. I'm pretty sure you can set the ring to action keys too.

This mod looks wonderful, but I can't even figure out how to use the docking ring. I'm trying to package up 3 or 4 OKS (Orbital Kolonization System) inflatable modules, which are floppy and wobble around when linked together as the payload on a rocket. I can manage to get the modules inside at least some of the CTS parts, although I'm not sure which CTS parts are best to use.

But once I dock the modules at my space station, I want to remove the CTS cages or trusses, or, alternatively, dock the payload and then back out with my tug still wearing the cages. How do I do that? I can get a docking ring, or even two docking rings, attached to the bottom of a cage. But I'm not sure what to do next. Do I use two rings or one? What do I attach to what?

Thanks in advance. The mod does looks beautiful; I just need to learn how to use it.

Thanks for the mod!

One question: How do i make FAR recognize things in the closed cargobays as "shielded"? ATM i lost Parts in the Bay due "aerodynamic stress".

This mod looks wonderful, but I can't even figure out how to use the docking ring. I'm trying to package up 3 or 4 OKS (Orbital Kolonization System) inflatable modules, which are floppy and wobble around when linked together as the payload on a rocket. I can manage to get the modules inside at least some of the CTS parts, although I'm not sure which CTS parts are best to use.

But once I dock the modules at my space station, I want to remove the CTS cages or trusses, or, alternatively, dock the payload and then back out with my tug still wearing the cages. How do I do that? I can get a docking ring, or even two docking rings, attached to the bottom of a cage. But I'm not sure what to do next. Do I use two rings or one? What do I attach to what?

Thanks in advance. The mod does looks beautiful; I just need to learn how to use it.

Just use them the way you'd use stock docking rings. Treat it like a bunch of fuel tanks chained together. And make sure the docking part of the docking ring is facing the correct way. You want:

[Docking Ring] [Cargo] [Docking Ring] [Docking Ring] [Cargo] [Docking Ring] ... Repeating as needed

Small bug report, or at least... I don't get it

The small mounting plate in the Arched Frame V2 has it's node pointed upwards, meaning if you mount something on it, it has the same orientation as the frame itself. A docking port there (i know, could be surface-mounted ) would point alongside the frame, not "inside" the frame.

A small MM config to reduce the prices to 10% of their original mod value.
First of all, thanks invultri. I configed your config

I went through and made individual tweaks to the prices based on costs of similar parts in KW Rocketry and Near Future Construction. Basically I pulled numbers out of my... imagination, but they should be closer to being reasonable now rather than 2100 across the board, let alone 21000 

@PART[TALCapsule01]
{
	cost = 3600
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoASeparator]
{
	cost = 500
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoASeparatorHollow]
{
	cost = 650
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoAdapter]
{
	cost = 750
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoAdapterPF]
{
	cost = 750
}

@PART[ProceduralFairingBase]
{
	cost = 750
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoBay]
{
	cost = 1400
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoFrame]
{
	cost = 450
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoFrameArch]
{
	cost = 600
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoFrameArchMount]
{
	cost = 700
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoFrameTube]
{
	cost = 850
}

@PART[TALLargeCargoDockingRing]
{
	cost = 1200
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoASeparator]
{
	cost = 300
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoASeparatorHollow]
{
	cost = 425
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoAdapter]
{
	cost = 200
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoAdapterPF]
{
	cost = 200
}

@PART[ProceduralFairingBase]
{
	cost = 200
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoBay]
{
	cost = 650
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoFrame]
{
	cost = 150
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoFrameArch]
{
	cost = 225
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoFrameArchMount]
{
	cost = 350
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoFrameTube]
{
	cost = 450
}

@PART[TALMediumCargoDockingRing]
{
	cost = 900
}

Edited September 5, 2014 by BadManiac

Very nice BadManiac.

If I read the Module Manager documentation correctly you should add a '@' before the cost (@cost = 750). Otherwise you will add another "cost" attribute to the item.

Just use them the way you'd use stock docking rings. Treat it like a bunch of fuel tanks chained together. And make sure the docking part of the docking ring is facing the correct way. You want:

[Docking Ring] [Cargo] [Docking Ring] [Docking Ring] [Cargo] [Docking Ring] ... Repeating as needed

Which side of these docking rings is the "docking" side?
